brief_title: Efficacy and Safety of the Rivastigmine Transdermal Patch in Patients With Probable Alzheimer's Disease
brief_summary: The goal of this research study is to evaluate the safety and efficacy of the rivastigmine transdermal patch in patients with probable Alzheimer's Disease.
criteria: Inclusion Criteria: - Diagnosis of dementia of the Alzheimer's type - Males, and females who are surgically sterile or one year postmenopausal - A primary caregiver willing to accept responsibility for supervising the treatment Exclusion Criteria: - Any condition (other than Alzheimer's) that could explain patient's dementia - An advanced, severe or unstable disease that may put the patient at special risk - Current diagnosis of active, uncontrolled seizure disorder or unstable cardiovascular disease
